qas.question: Who did Tony Blair side with?
Why did Blair side with Bush?
Who has an active Iraq War inquiry?
Was the idea of the Iraq War popular or unpopular in Western countries?
Who did Blair ally with during the war in Afghanistan?
What caused Blair to win political support?
Who considered the war to be legal?
What war was popular in most western countries?

plausible_answers.text: decisions that led up to the Iraq war

qas.question: What is the subject of Blair's Iraq Inquiry?

context: A perceived turning point was when Blair controversially allied himself with US <a0_0>President <b4_0>George W. Bush<b4_0/><a0_0/> in supporting <a1_0>the <b5_0>Iraq War<b5_0/><a1_0/>, which caused him to lose much of his political support. The <b6_0>UN Secretary-General<b6_0/>, among many, considered the war illegal. The <b7_0>Iraq War<b7_0/> was <a3_0>deeply unpopular<a3_0/> in most western countries, with Western governments divided in their support and under pressure from worldwide popular protests. The <b8_0>decisions that led up to the Iraq war<b8_0/> and its subsequent conduct are currently the subject of <a2_0>Sir John Chilcot<a2_0/>'s Iraq Inquiry.
